rules.natural: If the court challenged the wine law, then the court upheld the wine law.
Provided that the court challenged the wine law, the court overturned the wine law follows.
Under the condition that the court overturned the wine law, the court does not uphold the wine law.
Either the vineyard harvested grapes or, assuming the vineyard planted grapes, then provided the alcohol trade is not legal, fermentation is restricted.
Whenever grapes are fermented into wine, the vineyard processed grapes.
Grapes are fermented into wine or grapes are distilled into spirits.
If the agency regulated alcohol, then the agency enforced standards.
Supposing the agency inspected the vineyard, then if grapes are distilled into spirits, the vineyard does not harvest grapes.
Under the condition that fermentation is restricted, fermentation is banned.
Provided that the agency monitored production, the agency inspected the vineyard.
If the agency enforced standards, then the agency monitored production.
Whenever the state taxed wine, wine production is approved.
Either the state taxed wine or the state taxed spirits.
Provided the producer violated rules, the producer was fined.
If wine production is approved, then given that it is not the case that if the alcohol trade is not legal then fermentation is restricted, fermentation is prohibited.
Provided wine production is licensed, then under the condition that it is not the case that if the alcohol trade is not legal then fermentation is restricted, fermentation is prohibited.
If Congress passed the wine bill, then wine production is approved.
Either Congress passed the wine bill or Congress rejected the wine bill.
Whenever Congress rejected the wine bill, wine production is licensed.
The wine law was amended or wine production is approved or wine production is licensed.
If it is not the case that if the state taxed spirits then wine production is licensed, the producer violated rules.
Under the condition that it is not the case that if the producer violated rules then the producer is not fined, the producer's license is suspended.
Provided that it is not the case that if the producer violated rules then the producer is not fined, the producer's license is not suspended.
If it is not the case that if the president vetoed the wine law then the wine law was not amended, the court challenged the wine law.
If it is not the case that if the alcohol trade is not legal then fermentation is restricted, then fermentation is not prohibited.
If the alcohol trade is not legal, then fermentation is not banned.
